subject: Sealing Violation Exception
msgSnippet: Hi all, I ve got this problem when I run a test that uses a specific class contained in a sealed jar: java.lang.SecurityException: sealing violation: can t
messageBody:
Hi all,

I've got this problem when I run a test that uses a specific
class contained in a sealed jar:

java.lang.SecurityException: sealing violation: can't seal package
org.blah.util: already loaded

I got this class in my project:

org.blah.util.BlahLogger

And inside a sealed jar I got this class:

org.blah.util.BlahProperties

The classloader loads BlahLogger first, and when it tries load
BlahProperties (sealing the package from the jar)
I get the above exception.

The thing is, this project is already running in Tomcat 5.5.17
without any problem. This only happens when I try to unit test
the business objects using junit 4.4. I haven't tried it with
previous versions of junit. I've already checked the classpath,
and there's no duplication of jars.

I'm using Eclipse 3.2.0 to run the tests.

Does anyone know how to solve this problem?

Thanks in advance for any help.

Danniel.
